connect4Client

Class Connect4

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • connect4Client.Connect4
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    connect4Client.GameConstants, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Connect4
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.lang.Runnable, connect4Client.GameConstants
    This is the Connect 4 client it is in charge of setting the turns for players and receiving status messages from the server.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • connectToServer

        private void connectToServer()

      • run

        public void run()
        This is the game loop in the while loop which runs while continue to play is true a check message is sent before the move is sent over. This is to check if the other player exited when it was not their turn
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getDropPos

        public int getDropPos(int col,
             java.lang.String counter)
        This forces the counters to drop to the bottom of the column it uses an, if else statement to determine the next available row. It starts by checking the bottom row and if that is taken it will progress to the next until it finds a free row.
        Parameters:
        col - The column to be checked
        counter - The counter to put into the cell
        Returns:
        Returns the row to send to the server
